Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/15/25, two staff members transported a youth to the hospital
and one staff member asked the youth if they could score with the
staff member. The staff member had some additional verbal
exchanges that made the youth uncomfortable. On 3/16/25, the
staff member made a derogatory comment when a female staff
bent over to pick up something off the floor. The staff member also
made intimidating comments when the youth reported the
information to a supervisor.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 03/17/2025. Staff 1
reported on 03/17/2025 that Youth A reported Staff 3 had made
some inappropriate comments to her on 03/15/2025. She and
Staff 3 had transported Youth A to the hospital on 03/15/2025.
While in the hospital Staff 1 had stepped out of the room to take a
phone call, and Youth A was in the room with Staff 3. Youth A told
Staff 1 that’s when Staff 3 made the comments about liking Youth
A and buying her a candy bar. Youth A told Staff 1 that Staff 3
said Youth A is lucky he likes her that’s why he bought her the
candy bar. Youth A told her that Staff 3 asked Youth A if she
thought he could “score” with a female staff. Youth A did not
provide the staff’s name. Youth A told Staff 1 that Staff 3 told
Youth A “she is lucky he like likes her, because he only rides with
special girls.” Staff 1 denied hearing Staff 3 make the comments.
Youth A told her on 03/16/2025, when Staff 3 started his shift,
Staff 3 asked Youth A if she missed him. Youth A further reported
that when Staff 2 bent to pick up something Staff 3 looked at Staff
2’s behind and said, “damn girl.” Staff 1 said Staff 3 is a new
employee and had just started working on the unit.
Consumer Rights Officer was interviewed at the facility on
03/18/2025. Consumer Rights Officer reported Youth A reported
the incident to Staff 1 on 03/17/2025, Staff 3 was immediately
removed from Youth A’s unit and is now on administrative leave
pending the investigation. Consumer Rights Officer said Staff 3 is
a new employee and has only been working on the unit for one
2

week. Staff 3 did complete all new hire training and has no
disciplinary record.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 03/18/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for six months. She said on 03/15/2025
she was transported to the hospital by Staff 1 and Staff 3. She
said Staff 1 made several remarks that made her feel
uncomfortable. He told her he only lets special girls ride in the car
with him, talked about liking a female staff at the facility, and told
her she should be feeling lucky that he likes her. Youth A said
Staff 3 told her she is lucky he likes her and that’s why he bought
her the candy bar. She said the following day when he came in to
work, he asked Youth A if she missed him. Youth A said the same
day, Staff 2 bent down to pick up something and Staff 3 said
“damn girl.” Youth A said there was another time she and Youth B
were having a conversation about shaving and Staff 3 said he
does not like hair on his girls.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 03/18/2025. Staff 2
reported she was assigned to work with Youth A on 03/16/2025.
Staff 2 reported she heard Staff 3 ask Youth A if she missed him
when he started his shift. She also heard Staff 3 say “damn girl,”
when she bent down to pick up something off the table.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 03/27/2025. Staff 3 has
been working at the facility for one month and had completed all
training including CPI. Staff 3 reported he and Staff 1 transported
Youth A to the hospital on 03/15/2025, and they were in the
hospital for several hours. Youth A had missed dinner and was
complaining about being hungry, so he bought her a candy bar
from the vending machine. He denied making any remarks about
another staff member or telling Youth A she is “special and he
likes her.” He further denied asking Youth A if she missed him the
following day or saying the word ‘damn” when a staff member bent
down. Staff 3 adamantly denied making any inappropriate
comments to the youths or other staff members. He said he has
only been working on the unit for one day and Youth A is very
manipulative and is the one that was making inappropriate
comments and cussing at him.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 04/09/2025. Youth B is
placed on the same unit as Youth A. Youth B has been at the
facility for 18 months. Youth B reported she heard Staff 3 telling
Youth A that she is his favorite. She also heard Staff 3 say “damn”
when Staff 2 bent down to pick up something. Youth B said she
and Youth A were having a conversation about shaving their legs
3

and Staff 3 joined the conversation and said he does not like hair
on girls. She said that made her feel very uncomfortable.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 03/17/2025, written by Staff 1.
Incident report is consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Vista Maria Staff and Client Interaction All Vista Maria staff
should conduct themselves in a professional and
appropriate manner when interacting with the clients in our
care.
• Vista Maria Harassment Policy: Policy states that the
facility does not tolerate verbal or physical conduct by an
employee who harasses, or interferes with another staff
work, who creates an intimidating, offensive or hostile
environment, and who makes submitting to such conduct
an implicit condition of employment.
• Staff 3 has no disciplinary records. Staff 3 completed all
new hire training on 03/01/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance with the licensing rule.
Based on staff and youths’ interviews there’s sufficient evidence to
support that Staff 3 lacks the ability to perform the duties assigned
as he made inappropriate and derogatory comments towards
youth that made them feel uncomfortable.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
